[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [Edge Case] [Function signature mismatch] If a function exists with the correct name but wrong signature (different parameters), can this cause type confusion vulnerabilities when the VM invokes it? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [Edge Case] [Module version mismatch] During protocol upgrades, if the Move framework version changes but these constants don't, can version mismatches cause execution failures or security vulnerabilities? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [Dependency] [account_config dependency] Does account_config::CORE_CODE_ADDRESS have proper validation and initialization order guarantees, or can it be uninitialized when these lazy statics are created? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [Dependency] [move_core_types version] Are the move_core_types dependencies (ModuleId, IdentStr) from a verified version, or can dependency confusion attacks inject malicious implementations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [Dependency] [once_cell safety] Does the once_cell::sync::Lazy implementation handle all edge cases (panic during initialization, recursive initialization), or can these cause security issues? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [Type Safety] [ModuleId construction] Does ModuleId::new() validate that the address and module name combination is valid and doesn't allow malformed module identifiers? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [Type Safety] [IdentStr validation] Does ident_str! macro perform compile-time validation of identifier syntax, or can it accept invalid identifiers that cause runtime failures? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [Type Safety] [Const correctness] Are all public constants properly marked as const (for function names) vs static (for ModuleId), ensuring no runtime modification is possible? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [Monitoring] [Module resolution logging] When these system modules are resolved during VM execution, is there adequate logging to detect if wrong modules are being called due to constant errors? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [Monitoring] [Initialization failures] If lazy static initialization fails for any system module, are errors properly logged with sufficient context to debug the root cause? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [Compatibility] [Module name changes] If Move framework modules are renamed during an upgrade, can the VM detect the mismatch and prevent execution, or will it silently fail causing state divergence? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [Compatibility] [Function deprecation] If system functions are deprecated and removed from the framework, do these constants cause the VM to panic or can it handle missing functions gracefully? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [Critical Path] [Account creation failure] If CREATE_ACCOUNT_IF_DOES_NOT_EXIST constant is wrong, can this prevent all new account creation and break fundamental blockchain functionality? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [Critical Path] [Authentication failure] If AUTHENTICATE constant resolution fails, would this lock out all users from their accounts, causing permanent fund freezing? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [Critical Path] [DKG failure] If FINISH_WITH_DKG_RESULT is incorrect, can this prevent epoch transitions entirely, halting validator set updates and potentially causing network stall? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [Critical Path] [Fee collection failure] If EMIT_FEE_STATEMENT or TRANSACTION_FEE_MODULE constants are wrong, can this break all fee collection and validator incentives? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [Invariant] [Core address immutability] Is there a security invariant that account_config::CORE_CODE_ADDRESS must always be 0x1, and is this enforced at compile time to prevent module spoofing? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [Invariant] [Initialization atomicity] Is lazy static initialization atomic across all system modules, ensuring no module is partially initialized during concurrent access? (High)
